page.title: 17The Cemetery, Gt. Clacton
page.content: Since Clacton is such a young resort (only about a hundred years) the land was quickly bought up and developed. This meant that there were only two established churches in the area,{St John's}and{St James'. Obviously there were many more needed as the town grew in size, but they could only buy a small plot of land on which to build. A communal cemetary was the only solution since the church possessed very little land. The cemetary was opened in 1899 and covered about 50,000 sq.metres. In recent years more land has been acquired to make an annexe of 20,000 sq. metres across the road.
